sub_title: Retired - no longer looking for jobs or assignments
summary:
- Enthousiaste docent Engels en Frans met passie voor lesgeven
- 8 jaar leservaring in het voortgezet onderwijs op een brede scholengemeenschap (VMBO, HAVO, Atheneum en Gymnasium)
- Ervaring als klassenleraar en coach
- Zeer bedreven in werken met IT-hulpmiddelen
- Veel ervaring in virtueel werken als ook lesgeven op afstand (Teams, Google Meet, Google Forms & Classroom)
- Leergierig en continu bezig met verbeteren didactische vaardigheden
- Op zoek om zoveel mogelijk formatieve en activerende werkvormen (zoals CLIL) in mijn lessen toe te passen
- Ook jarenlange ervaring in diverse IT-functies bij internationaal bedrijf: leidinggeven, adviseren, projecten leiden (PMP, PRINCE2, SCRUM & KANBAN), verbeteringen identificeren en doorvoeren, IT process (ITIL) consultancy: assessments, audits en aanbevelen & doorvoeren van verbeteringen

education.field_of_study: English Language & Literature/Letters and Applied Linguistics

school.name: Stichting Opleiding Leraren, College of Education at Utrecht

authors.headline: Retired - no longer looking for jobs or assignments

profile_positions.description:
- Enthousiaste docent Engels en Frans met passie voor lesgeven
- 7 jaar leservaring in het voortgezet onderwijs op een brede scholengemeenschap (VMBO, HAVO, Atheneum en Gymnasium)
- Ervaring als klassenleraar en coach
- Zeer bedreven in werken met IT-hulpmiddelen (Word, PowerPoint, Excel, Outlook, SharePoint, SOM, etc.)
- Veel ervaring in virtueel werken als ook lesgeven op afstand (Teams)
- Leergierig en continue bezig met verbeteren didactische vaardigheden
- Werk graag samen met wil graag van collega's leren. Deel ook graag eigen ervaringen, lesmethoden, lesmateriaal en aanpak van problemen
- Ervaring opgedaan met activerende werkvormen zoals CLIL. Hierover cursus gevolgd en meteen aan de slag gegaan dit in mijn lessen toe te passen
profile_positions.title: Docent Engels, regulier en tto

profile_positions.description:
Looking for a new challenging assignment:
- Project Manager (PRINCE2)
- Service Improvement Manager: baseline assessment (CMM), improvement proposal & implementation
profile_positions.title: Available for new job or interim assignment

profile_positions.description:
Leading the Infrastructure workstream of the SAP Implementation program. Responsible for all adjustments and new requirements necessary for building, testing en rolling out the new ERP environment (SAP, master data and interfaces with the connected legacy application portfolio). Key deliverables:
- System Integration Testing environment  including testing workstations simulating the to-be production environment
- User Acceptance Testing environment including testing workstations
- Training environment including training workstations
- Shadow environment for conducting RCA of major problems after go-live
profile_positions.title: Infra Project Manager SAP

profile_positions.description: Looking for a new challenging job or interim assignment
profile_positions.title: Available for new job or interim assignment

profile_positions.description:
Taking over Shell PM role for the Mobility Remediation project to structurally resolve a set of 6 different operational issues of Shell's global Mobile Voice Service:
1) Request Mgt and Order Fulfillment
2) Cost Mgt & Billing
3) Incident Mgt
4) Coverage & Carrier Mgt
5) Mobile subscriptons & device inventory
6) Service Mgt & reporting
Design & implement solutions, a modified support model and governance framework
profile_positions.title: PM Mobility Remediation Project in Managed Network Services

profile_positions.description: Lead ShareWise project designing & implementing support and governance structure for SharePoint support organisation. Working closely together with the business IM representatives and the ShareWise PMs of related projects
profile_positions.title: PM ShareWise Governance & Services Implementation Project

profile_positions.description: Global Lead deployment of ITSM processes and tools for DS. Agree with DV representatives in DS on deployment planning, scope and approach for planned process and tool changes. Subsequently lead the implementation: communication, stakeholder mgt, training, progress reporting till successful deployment and conduct review post go-live. Working closely together with the Enterprise Process and Tools Owners (in ES and ITSO)
profile_positions.title: Implementation Lead

profile_positions.description:
- Created a local L1 business application support capability
- Create Service Description of all IT services provided to AKCO and NCOC
- Design and roll out IT Service Mangement review board mtgs based on service reports defined in aforementioned
- Further mature the Service Mgt review mtgs and reporting
- Lead building of a new governance structure for the new Kashagan Venture companies
- Implement the governance structure after approval
- Develop a roadmap and plan for a sustainable IT Service Management capability
- Execute 2012 and partially 2013 programme for this plan
- Selected staff to execute the 2013 ITSM programme and hand over my responsibilities
profile_positions.title: IT Service Management Lead at NCPOC

profile_positions.description: Leading Service management improvement programme (ONE-Support) for EPBP (DSO). Implemented improvement recommendations. Led external EPBP benchmark (by Compass). Assisted in designing and setting up of support capability for SEIC. Global EP deployment mgr for new IT Service Mgt toolkit (target 2010). Business Programme Delivery Mgr for EP leading the EBST improvement programme. Conducted several service reviews (GAS, Salym). Leading implementation of new SLA framework (differentiated service tiers) in EP. Participated in the Marriage project for Energy Components. Created and implemented a common Transition to Support guide for PMs and Delivery Mgrs in EP. Acting Global Apps Support Mgr for global Production and Engineering applications. Leading project turning Staff Augmentation contract for IM/DRM support in a Managed Service Contract. Coaching and ensuring alignment between the EP EBST Process Network representatives.
profile_positions.title: Global EP Supportability Manager

profile_positions.description: Joined the GRASP project team to develop the global support model, the support processes and instructions for subsequent use of the IT4Shell support toolkit. In that capacity created the support model, made the L3 and L4 process documentation, procedures and instructions, a generic SLA for EP business application support and a number of ready-to-use templates (e.g., Quick Reference Guides for support staff, service review guidelines. Irone out (Shell & 3rd party) access issues with the toolset. Operationalise the support model, procedures and rolled out the tools, train and coach staff, develop standard reports. Feedback is used to further hone the documentation. Assure in evergreening process for key documents. Assist the Global EP Delivery Mgr in setting up operational organisation and see to a smooth handover. Participated in the SASP project as EP representative.
profile_positions.title: Service Management Lead EP GRASP Programme

profile_positions.description: Responsible for Finance, Workforce, Service Management and Office Management support for Application Support EU/A (SITI-ITDSEA). Improved timewriting discipline and utilisation. Implemented staff onboarding and exit procedure. Raised use of ServiceCenter and adherence to SIP and AAR to 100% by all operational support teams. Responsible for smooth migration of Apps Support department to GID. Successfully implemented ServiceCenter and trained new teams in LDM, London, Berre and Nanterre. Created ServiceCenter compliance reports for all teams. Responsible for 2 smooth moves to new office: first in Dec 2000 and then in May 2002 (including new office selection and big refurbishment programme). Both SAN (Service Assurance Network) and GSAN member for Application Support, as well as member of the E2E toolkit ER review board. Led a KM project for department (inventory, cleanup, creation of taxonomy and KM guidelines and migration to Global LiveLink). Chaired ITDSE SIP review board and completely reduced the European backlog of overdue AAR reports and actions. Learning: impact of having to provide a service with too few staff and how difficult it is to provide services to internal customers (departmental colleagues).
profile_positions.title: Business Manager Global Shared Application Support

profile_positions.description: Responsible for management of Helpdesk in Leidschendam (part of SSIs Europe Helpdesk organisation). Improved working practices developed new set of KPIs. Renegotiated contracts with agencies. Implemented various reorganisations: consolidations of mainframe Helpdesk teams and Registration Desks. Taken over 1st line support responsibility for 3 new customers: Van Ommeren (Rotterdam), Shell Solar Energy (Helmond) and SRTCA (Amsterdam). Participated in CTR project team visiting SPDC in Nigeria. Responsible for assessing their Helpdesk organisation and making recommendations for improving the Helpdesk prior to and after the creation of SSI Nigeria. Proven cost leadership; reduced operating costs significantly. Leading project to migrate remaining Helpdesk teams in Leidschendam to Wythenshawe; have assured a smooth transition
profile_positions.title: Helpdesk Manager Netherlands

profile_positions.description: Responsible for management information for divisional management team; improved reporting (standardising, automating), involved in several benchmarks (site services, desktop in particular), conducted a virus incident post-mortem, made proposal for common KPI reporting. Developed procedure for Service Acceptance Checklist. Actively participated in project team responsible for gaining new business: RTS. Assist in implementing first phase of transition (RTS Amsterdam organisation, SLA, tariffs, etc.)
profile_positions.title: Site Services Improvement

profile_positions.description: SCIS and in 1997 Shell IS Responsible for all site services for Rotterdam (SN, SNV, refinery Traders, STBV, fidiTEM, SOW at various locations throughout the Netherlands): Helpdesk, 2nd line support, LAN and system management, UGA, RACF and PC training services and all IT procurement, installation, maintenance and configuration management services. Further improved efficiency and turned it into a more commercial, customer focused organisation. Learning: impact of the major migration projects on the service delivery groups. Pros & cons of working with service contracts
profile_positions.title: Site Manager

profile_positions.description:
As part of Shell Netherlands responsible for above described I/structure services + voice services (PABX, contract management with telcos, all registration and MACs with regard to telephony and switchboard staff. Turned silo organised overhead organisation into customer focused service organisation delivering learly defined services at published prices and against service levels. Participated in benchmark of our services with HP, EDS and ICL. Set up KPI reporting of our services.
Learning: work with own (Shell) staff (7) and manage the mix of own and agency staff (14) from different contractor agencies. Have budget responsibility. Negotiate and manage contracts. Learnt great deal from BPR and subsequent reorganisation.
profile_positions.title: Head Desktop & Telecomms Services

profile_positions.description: Head Helpdesk and Learning Centre for SN, SNV and SNC customer in Rotterdam. Learning: how to work for a commercial company. Complexity of Shells IT infrastructure and how to support it.
profile_positions.title: Head Helpdesk

volunteer_experiences.role: Coach adolescent children how to do school homework who struggle with this
volunteer_experiences.description: A great learning experience that helped me become a better teacher
